subject: Put the spotlight on the Open Source project Junit
msgSnippet: Antelink launched in April a free byproduct from their R&D that enables the Open Source Community to check how many times a library is reused in Open Source
messageBody:
Antelink launched in April a free byproduct from their R&D that enables
the Open Source Community to check how many times a library is reused in
Open Source projects <http://www.antelink.com/community/rating> . This
service already focused on the TOP 100 most reused Open Source Java
components <http://www.antelink.com/blog/entry/top_100_most_reused_open>
.

In order to get the spotlight on Open Source projects
<http://www.antelink.com/blog/entry/change_is_comi%20ng_for_our> ,
Antelink will propose a weekly blog article on the most reused Open
Source Project.

The first project is JUnit, the famous Java automated test. It's
interesting to see that many projects seems to be stuck on the last
version of the 3.X branch
<http://www.antelink.com/blog/entry/junit_most_reused_open_source> ,
using the previous implementation based on class inheritance from the
framework interfaces, instead of JUnit 4.x based on the Java 5
annotations.

Do these figures fit with your experience using Junit?

Michael, community manager @antelink



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
